result.content:
HomeBeginnerCodeforces: A. Watermelon Codeforces: A. Watermelon May 20, 2012 No Comments beginner, implementation, math, non-technical, programming languages, python, tricks

The problem is from codeforces: http://www.codeforces.com/problemset/problem/4/A

Codeforces, 4A, Watermelon The problem is so easy that you might even falls into the trap (you might think judging if it is even or odd). 2 is even but the answer is NO.

The python solution is very straightforward:

n = int(raw_input())

if (n <= 2): print "NO" elif (n % 2 == 0): print "YES" else: print "NO" –EOF–

========================================

include

using namespace std;

int main() {
int w; cin >> w; cout << ((w % 2 == 0 && w != 2) ? "YES\n" : "NO\n"); return 0; }
